posts.post_content:
Banned in Modern.  
  
Yet 8 post is still legal in pauper, and there are fewer decks to punish you for doing nothing in first few turns. And there is indeed [somewhat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=205391) [broken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=194908) things you can do with tons of mana in pauper....  
  
But I guess I'm the only person thinking this (and [Empty the Warrens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empty the Warrens)) should have something done about them.
posts.html:
Banned in Modern.

Yet 8 post is still legal in pauper, and there are fewer decks to punish you for doing nothing in first few turns. And there is indeed somewhat broken things you can do with tons of mana in pauper....

But I guess I'm the only person thinking this (and Empty the Warrens) should have something done about them.

posts.post_content: Turn all lands into creatures via one of the many effects that does so, then play [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave). Proceed to collect obscene amounts of mana.

Rating:

posts.post_content: I run 4 of these and 4 [Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost)s in my casual artifact deck. It's a total beast, even if you get a starting hand with just a single cloudpost you know you're golden. It's always such a blast to hard-cast [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus) on turn 4 or 5. And [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus) on the next.

posts.post_content:
You should probably run forests and [crop rotation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=crop rotation)s if you are depending on this.   
Personally, I prefer [Urza's Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urza's Tower) and friends due to the fact that they come into play untapped.

posts.post_content:
[Scapeshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scapeshift) into four of this, four of [Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost) and four [Vesuva](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuva)s and you can instantly fill that handy dandy [Helix Pinnacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helix Pinnacle).  
  
Instantly as in when they untap of course.  
  
UNLESS! You happen to have out one or more [Amulet of Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Vigor)s. :P

Rating:

posts.post_content: I don't think this card is as over powered as people think, it comes into play tapped so you can't do anything with it turn one, and on turn two you only have two mana to spend any ways, even if you are lucky enough to get [Amulet of Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Vigor) in your opening hand. compared to other mana ramp it actually lacks. and are you really going to run 4 amulet of vigor? and even then you might not get it, so what do you do run search cards? well now even more cards in you deck don't do anything. also this is assuming you get all of your cloudposts and vesuvas on que, which is unlikely and there is only a small number of cards you can use to search for them, and only one of them isn't green. so what are you going to do? run more search cards? run mana fixing to play green spells? or you could just go mono green and play all your eldrazi just as quick but more reliably.
posts.html:
